metadata.title: CVE-2018-1124 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
procps-ng before version 3.3.15 is vulnerable to multiple integer overflowsleading to a heap corruption in file2strvec function. This allows aprivilege escalation for a local attacker who can create entries in procfsby starting processes, which could result in crashes or arbitrary codeexecution in proc utilities run by other users.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libprocps4 - 2:3.3.10-4ubuntu2.4
procps - 2:3.3.10-4ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: procps package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.3.10-4ubuntu2.4').
